Global

Methods

node(valueopt, infoopt) → {Node}

Creates a Node proxy with a value and node options (both optional). If no value is given, the default is null and if no options are given, the default is {}.
The info parameter can be any object, containing any auxiliary information (i.e., containing node identification, specifying the type of node, etc).
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
value * <optional>
 null Initial node value
info Object <optional>
 {} exponent - Arbitrary information about the node
Source:
  • node.js, line 26
Returns:
- The node proxy object result
Type
Node
